<Link id="l00192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="192"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// are the element selectors for the first operand and second operands</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00352" /><CodeLine lineNumber="352"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00353" /><CodeLine lineNumber="353"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Operand 0: the address of the containing 32-bit-aligned field</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00354" /><CodeLine lineNumber="354"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Operand 1: the compare value, in the low bits of an i32</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00355" /><CodeLine lineNumber="355"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Operand 2: the swap value, in the low bits of an i32</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00356" /><CodeLine lineNumber="356"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Operand 3: how many bits to rotate the i32 left to bring the first</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00357" /><CodeLine lineNumber="357"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//            operand into the high bits</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00358" /><CodeLine lineNumber="358"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Operand 4: the negative of operand 2, for rotating the other way</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00359" /><CodeLine lineNumber="359"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Operand 5: the width of the field in bits (8 or 16)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00360" /><CodeLine lineNumber="360" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/systemzisd/#a24fe7decb4ebdd8b4c7a774d65fcaa7eac29643ffd97b5dbd495a345eaf4abd48"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/systemzisd/#a24fe7decb4ebdd8b4c7a774d65fcaa7eac29643ffd97b5dbd495a345eaf4abd48">ATOMIC&#95;CMP&#95;SWAPW</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00361" /><CodeLine lineNumber="361"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00363" /><CodeLine lineNumber="363"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Val, CC, OUTCHAIN = ATOMIC&#95;CMP&#95;SWAP(INCHAIN, ptr, cmp, swap)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00428" /><CodeLine lineNumber="428" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/systemztargetlowering/#aeb38f046dab5e6966eb5856940ac43e5"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetloweringbase/#a35dc101b509721ffbfb58aba316de681">TargetLoweringBase::LegalizeTypeAction</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/systemztargetlowering/#aeb38f046dab5e6966eb5856940ac43e5">getPreferredVectorAction</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mvt">MVT</a> VT)</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00429" /><CodeLine lineNumber="429"><Highlight kind="keyword">    const override </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00430" /><CodeLine lineNumber="430"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Widen subvectors to the full width rather than promoting integer</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00431" /><CodeLine lineNumber="431"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// elements.  This is better because:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00432" /><CodeLine lineNumber="432"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00433" /><CodeLine lineNumber="433"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (a) it means that we can handle the ABI for passing and returning</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00434" /><CodeLine lineNumber="434"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     sub-128 vectors without having to handle them as legal types.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00435" /><CodeLine lineNumber="435"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00436" /><CodeLine lineNumber="436"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (b) we don&#39;t have instructions to extend on load and truncate on store,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00437" /><CodeLine lineNumber="437"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     so promoting the integers is less efficient.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00438" /><CodeLine lineNumber="438"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00439" /><CodeLine lineNumber="439"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (c) there are no multiplication instructions for the widest integer</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00440" /><CodeLine lineNumber="440"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     type (v2i64).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00441" /><CodeLine lineNumber="441"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (VT.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mvt/#a2e101ce5736aa0643639fd3adae18088">getScalarSizeInBits</a>() % 8 == 0)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00442" /><CodeLine lineNumber="442"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetloweringbase/#a35dc101b509721ffbfb58aba316de681a5290057031a9bc71850f61e757cb940e">TypeWidenVector</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00443" /><CodeLine lineNumber="443"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetloweringbase/#a59ae7f93fccb0ae431e82f8d74ba443c">TargetLoweringBase::getPreferredVectorAction</a>(VT);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00444" /><CodeLine lineNumber="444"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00445" /><CodeLine lineNumber="445"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00448" /><CodeLine lineNumber="448"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// i128 inline assembly operand.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00449" /><CodeLine lineNumber="449"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (VT == MVT::i128 &amp;&amp; RegisterVT &amp;&amp; &#42;RegisterVT == MVT::Untyped)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00450" /><CodeLine lineNumber="450"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> 1;</Highlight></CodeLine>
